metadata.case_name: State of Maharashtra v. First Grade Clerks (C.As. Nos. 259 & 260 of 1964)

facts.text: Three First Grade clerks attached to the offices of the Collectors of Wardha, Bhandara and Chanda districts filed a petition under Art. 226 of the Constitution in the Bombay High Court, originally by two as Secretary and Member of Ministerial Services Associations but treated as personal petitions.

Petitioners sought writ of mandamus for equation of their posts with Aval Karkuns under ss. 115 and 116 of States Reorganization Act, 1956 read with Allocated Government Servants (Absorption, Seniority, Pay & Allowances) Rules, 1957.

Government Resolution No. SR INT 1057/VI dated October 21, 1957, together with Item No. 8 and Note 5, ordered posts of First Grade clerks in Deputy Commissioners' offices to continue on existing scale of Rs. 80-5-130.
Government Resolution No. SR INT/2159/21365-F dated October 12, 1960 fixed new scales of pay Rs. 100-8-140 for the posts from May 1, 1960.
Bombay High Court judgment dated October 27, 1961 rejected equivalence but held new scales commence from November 1, 1956, not May 1, 1960; issued appropriate writs.
High Court certified case under Art. 132(1) and all three clauses of Art. 133, leading to cross-appeals by State (CA 259/1964) and petitioners (CA 260/1964).
States reorganisation took effect on November 1, 1956; necessary to divide and integrate services under Part X, ss. 115 and 116 of States Reorganization Act, 1956.
Scale of pay for First Grade clerks immediately before November 1, 1956 was Rs. 80-5-130.
Duties of Aval Karkuns in former Bombay State were entirely different from those of First Grade clerks.
Allocated Government Servants Rules, 1957 made under s. 115 and Art. 309; dispute governed by rules 10 and 12.

legal_issues.text: Whether posts of First Grade clerks ought to be equated with Aval Karkuns.
Whether revised scales of pay should commence on November 1, 1956 or May 1, 1960.
Whether failure to assign equivalent post and rule 12 are discriminatory.

petitioner_arguments.text: Government bound to find equivalent post, nearest being Aval Karkuns; failure to assign equivalent post discriminates against them; rule 12 discriminatory.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: ss. 115 and 116 of States Reorganization Act, 1956; rule 12 of Allocated Government Servants Rules, 1957

respondent_arguments.text: No equivalent post to Aval Karkuns as duties different; under rule 10, Government may otherwise direct pay scales from date other than November 1, 1956, such as May 1, 1960.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: rule 10 of Allocated Government Servants Rules, 1957 ('except where Government otherwise directs')

court_reasoning.text: No obligation to equate every post; no equivalent post found as duties of Aval Karkuns entirely different; possible for special posts not to fit, to be treated independently with regard to scales in principal successor State.
court_reasoning.key_observation: State Government not wrong in declining to equate; no discrimination as equivalence not compelled where no equivalent available.

court_reasoning.text: Rule 12 provides for special treatment of odd cases without discrimination; made due to multifarious posts; ss. 115-116 do not compel equivalence in every case.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Discrimination proved only if equivalence not carried out despite available equivalent post.

court_reasoning.text: 'Except where Government otherwise directs' in rule 10 allows departure from Bombay scale or equivalent post scale, but not from operative date of November 1, 1956; words positioned to modify scales under (i) and (ii), not date.
court_reasoning.key_observation: All rules (10-19, 23) repeatedly fix November 1, 1956 as dateline; rule 12 power to prescribe new scale also from that date.

court_reasoning.text: Government Resolution dated October 12, 1960 revised scale to Rs. 100-8-140 but erroneously from May 1, 1960 instead of November 1, 1956.
court_reasoning.key_observation: High Court correctly cancelled May 1, 1960 and fixed November 1, 1956.

holdings.text: No equivalence between First Grade clerks and Aval Karkuns required; rule 12 not discriminatory.
Revised pay scales applicable from November 1, 1956, not May 1, 1960.
No discrimination in not declaring equivalent post or under rule 12.

statutes_cited.name: States Reorganisation Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Deal with division and integration of services; empower rules for absorption, equivalence, pay scales.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Art. 226 for writ petition; Art. 309 for rules; Arts. 132,133 for certificate to appeal.

statutes_cited.name: Allocated Government Servants (Absorption, Seniority, Pay & Allowances) Rules, 1957
statutes_cited.relevance: Govern pay scales for allocated servants from November 1, 1956; equivalence; special cases without equivalence.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed appeal by State Government (CA 259/1964) upholding High Court's order that pay scales commence from November 1, 1956; dismissed appeal by clerks (CA 260/1964) upholding rejection of equivalence with Aval Karkuns and no discrimination.
outcome.relief_granted: Writs to effectuate pay scales from November 1, 1956 upheld.

key_quotes.text: "Discrimination can be proved only if equivalence is not carried out although an equivalent post is available."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines threshold for proving discrimination in equivalence.

key_quotes.text: "The words 'except where Government otherwise directs' were not intended to change the date on which the scales of pay were to come into operation, namely, November 1, 1956."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets scope of rule 10; fixes operative date.

key_quotes.text: "November 1, 1956 is always the fixed date line."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Emphasizes uniform dateline across rules for pay scales.
